intro: Ixia longituba subsp. longituba, commonly known as the long-tube ixia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It produces showy, long-lasting blooms that attract pollinators such as birds and insects. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
